page.title: 05Cliffe Hill Quarry-Stanton
page.content: We interviewed Mr.Puttick, Project Engineer and Mr.Smith, Manager at Cliffe Hill,one of the most important {hard rock quarries}in this country. The quarry supplies 1.4 million tonnes of{granite}a year,most of the stone is used for{motorways}and {railway ballast. The quarry is over 900 meters in length,400 meters wide and 90 meters deep.There are six levels to the quarry each about fifteen metres high.The{granite}is believed to go down another 100 metres. There are 21 vehicles on the site 6 are large dumper trucks and 48 road lorries.The large dumper trucks carry 50 tonnes each and cost about 160 thousand pounds. The{new road}cost half a million pounds to make and will allow the quarry to expand.
